item.title: 消息人士称，Polymarket 接近 2 亿美元融资，估值超过 10 亿美元
item.description: 一位熟知内情的人士周二告诉路透社，Polymarket即将在一轮融资中筹集到2亿美元资金，对全球最大预测市场的估值将超过10亿美元。【原文：Polymarket is close to raising $200 million in a funding round that values the world's biggest prediction market at more than $1 billion, a person familiar with the matter told Reuters on Tuesday.】

item.title: 美国 6 月消费者信心指数下降
item.description: 由于家庭对未来六个月的商业状况和就业前景感到担忧，6 月份美国消费者信心意外下降。【原文：U.S. consumer confidence unexpectedly deteriorated in June as households worried about business conditions and employment prospects over the next six months.】

item.title: 独家报道消息人士称，优步支持的电动自行车初创公司 Lime 已为美国 IPO 聘请银行
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，由优步科技公司（Uber Technologies）支持、运营电动自行车和滑板车网络的初创公司 Lime 已聘请投资银行帮助其筹备期待已久的美国首次公开募股。【原文：Lime, a startup backed by Uber Technologies that operates an electric bike and scooter network, has hired investment banks to help it prepare for a long-awaited U.S. initial public offering, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 美国和欧洲航空公司股价因以色列与伊朗停战的希望而上涨
item.description: 周二，美国和欧洲的航空公司股价上涨，而油价则因预期以色列和伊朗之间的停火协议将得以维持而下跌。【原文：Shares of U.S. and European airlines rose on Tuesday, while oil prices declined on expectations that a ceasefire between Israel and Iran would hold.】

item.title: 普京授权创建国家信息应用程序，以打击 WhatsApp 和 Telegram
item.description: 俄罗斯总统弗拉基米尔-普京（Vladimir Putin）周二签署了一项法律，授权开发一款由国家支持、与政府服务相结合的信息应用程序，莫斯科正努力减少对 WhatsApp 和 Telegram 等平台的依赖。【原文：Russian President Vladimir Putin on Tuesday signed a law authorising the development of a state-backed messaging app integrated with government services, as Moscow strives to reduce its dependence on platforms like WhatsApp and Telegram.】

item.title: Anthropic 在作者版权诉讼中赢得有关人工智能的关键裁决
item.description: 旧金山的一名联邦法官周一晚些时候裁定，根据美国版权法，Anthropic公司未经许可使用书籍训练其人工智能系统是合法的。【原文：A federal judge in San Francisco ruled late Monday that Anthropic's use of books without permission to train its artificial intelligence system was legal under U.S. copyright law.】

item.title: 曾主导在线招聘网站的 CareerBuilder + Monster 申请破产
item.description: 曾经主导在线招聘行业的 CareerBuilder + Monster 周二申请破产保护，并表示计划出售旗下业务。【原文：CareerBuilder + Monster, which once dominated the online recruitment industry, filed for Chapter 11 bankruptcy protection on Tuesday and said it plans to sell its businesses.】

item.title: 邮轮需求稳定，嘉年华上调年度利润目标
item.description: 嘉年华集团（Carnival Corp）周二上调了年度盈利预期，第二季度营收超过预期，原因是预订前往加勒比海和地中海等目的地游轮的游客需求强劲。【原文：Carnival Corp , raised its annual profit forecast after beating second-quarter revenue estimates on Tuesday driven by resilient demand from travelers booking cruises to destinations including the Caribbean and Mediterranean.】

item.title: 美国第一季度经常账户创历史新高
item.description: 第一季度，美国经常账户赤字扩大，创下历史新高，原因是企业为避免唐纳德-特朗普总统对进口商品征收高额关税而提前进口。【原文：The U.S. current account deficit widened to a record high in the first quarter as businesses front-loaded imports to avoid President Donald Trump's hefty tariffs on imported goods.】

item.title: 美联储主席哈马克认为近期无需降息
item.description: 克利夫兰联邦储备银行行长贝丝-哈马克（Beth Hammack）周二表示，她认为在贸易关税对通胀的影响仍存在很大不确定性的情况下，没有迫切需要降息。【原文：Federal Reserve Bank of Cleveland President Beth Hammack said Tuesday she sees no pressing need to cut interest rates when there’s still a lot of uncertainty what trade tariffs will do to inflation, which is still above the central bank’suncertainty what“Given the resilience of the economy thus far, the risks from maintaining the current policy setting appear low, and I don’t see a weakening in the economy that would merit imminent rate cuts, though I remain attentive to that possibility,” Hammack said in the text of a speech to be delivered in London.】

item.title: 前特斯拉和谷歌工程师为人工智能文本检测初创公司 Pangram 筹集 400 万美元资金
item.description: Pangram 是一家由前特斯拉和谷歌员工创办的初创公司，该公司已筹集到约 400 万美元的种子基金，用于扩展其检测人工智能生成文本的工具，因为学校和企业正在努力应对 ChatGPT 等应用程序激增的使用率。【原文：Pangram, a startup founded by former Tesla and Google employees, has raised about $4 million in seed funding to expand its tools that detect AI-generated text as schools and businesses grapple with the surging use of applications such as ChatGPT.】

item.title: 麦当劳和 Krispy Kreme 因成本增加而终止美国甜甜圈销售合作关系
item.description: 麦当劳和甜甜圈制造商 Krispy Kreme 周二表示，他们将于 7 月结束在美国的合作关系，因为两家公司都在努力控制与合资企业相关的成本。【原文：McDonald's and donut maker Krispy Kreme said on Tuesday they would end their partnership in the United States by July, as the companies struggled to manage the costs associated with the venture.】

item.title: 亚马逊将于年底前在美国小城市和农村地区扩展 Prime 配送服务
item.description: 亚马逊公司（Amazon.com）周二表示，该公司计划在2025年底前将其当日达和次日达Prime快递服务扩展到美国4000多个较小的城市和农村地区。【原文：Amazon.com plans to expand its same-day and next-day Prime delivery services to over 4,000 smaller cities and rural regions in the United States by the end of 2025, it said on Tuesday, as the company doubles down on efforts to grow its domestic footprint.】

item.title: 鲍威尔重申降息可以等待，因为美联储正在研究关税影响
item.description: 美国联邦储备委员会主席杰罗姆-鲍威尔（Jerome Powell）周二表示，在考虑唐纳德-特朗普总统要求的降息之前，央行需要更多时间来观察关税上涨是否会推动通胀率上升。【原文：U.S. Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell said on Tuesday the central bank needs more time to see if rising tariffs drive inflation higher before considering the interest rate cuts that President Donald Trump is demanding.】

item.title: 高盛首席执行官在法国评论文章中敦促欧洲审查 "霸道 "法规
item.description: 高盛集团首席执行官大卫-所罗门（David Solomon）周二在法国报纸《回声报》（Les Echos）上发表了一篇评论文章，敦促欧洲重新考虑其 "广泛的 "监管要求，因为这些要求给企业带来了不必要的负担。【原文：Goldman Sachs CEO David Solomon urged Europe to reconsider its "extensive" regulatory requirements through an opinion piece published in French newspaper Les Echos on Tuesday, as they place unnecessary burden on companies.】

item.title: 贝莱德推出得克萨斯州 ETF，吸引投资者兴趣
item.description: 贝莱德（BlackRock）周二表示，随着得克萨斯州作为美国经济活动中心的地位不断提升，该公司已推出一款以得克萨斯州为重点的交易所交易基金。【原文：BlackRock said on Tuesday it had launched a Texas-focused exchange-traded fund, as the state gains traction as a rising hub of economic activity in the United States.】

item.title: 法国调查人员命令特斯拉停止 "欺骗性商业行为
item.description: 法国调查人员周二命令特斯拉停止所谓的 "欺骗性商业行为"，否则将面临数千欧元的罚款。【原文：French investigators on Tuesday ordered Tesla to stop what they called "deceptive business practices" or face thousands of euros in fines.】

item.title: 大陆集团奥莫维奥公司的目标是在上市后长期提高销售额
item.description: 大陆集团汽车事业部将于今年 9 月以 Aumovio 的名称上市，该公司周二表示，随着该事业部更加专注于为公司增值的技术，希望能在长期内将销售额提高 22%。【原文：Continental's automotive division, set to go public in September under the name Aumovio, hopes to boost sales by 22% in the long term as it sharpens its focus on technologies that add value to the carved-out company, it said on Tuesday.】

item.title: 伊贝尔德罗拉任命美国业务主管为新任首席执行官
item.description: 西班牙电力公用事业公司 Iberdrola 周二表示，已任命其美国子公司 Avangrid 的首席执行官 Pedro Azagra Blazquez 担任新的集团首席执行官，接替现任首席执行官阿曼多-马丁内斯-马丁内斯。【原文：Spain's Iberdrola has appointed the chief of its U.S. subsidiary Avangrid, Pedro Azagra Blazquez, as new group chief executive, replacing current CEO Armando Martinez Martinez, the power utility company said on Tuesday.】

item.title: 随着可持续服装需求的增长，瑞典纺织品回收商 Syre 将与 Gap、Target 合作
item.description: H&M 投资的纺织品回收公司 Syre 周二表示，随着可持续时装需求的增长，该公司将向美国零售商 Gap 和 Target 提供回收的聚酯纤维。【原文：H&M -backed textile recycling firm Syre will provide recycled polyester to U.S. retailers Gap and Target , it said on Tuesday, as demand for sustainable fashion grows.】

item.title: 央行机构国际清算银行发出严厉的稳定币警告
item.description: 国际清算银行就稳定币带来的风险发出了最严厉的警告，并敦促各国迅速实现本国货币的代币化。【原文：The Bank for International Settlements issued its starkest warning yet on the risks posed by stablecoins and urged countries to move rapidly towards the tokenisation of their currencies.】

item.title: 优步和 Waymo 在亚特兰大推出自动驾驶打车服务
item.description: 优步科技公司（Uber Technologies）周二与 Alphabet 旗下 Waymo 公司合作，开始在亚特兰大提供自动驾驶打车服务。【原文：Uber Technologies on Tuesday is beginning autonomous ride-hailing in Atlanta with Alphabet unit Waymo after offering the service in Austin, Texas, since March.】

item.title: 西姆塞克表示，土耳其正在采取加密货币交易措施以阻止洗钱活动
item.description: 土耳其财政部长穆罕默德-西姆塞克（Mehmet Simsek）周二表示，土耳其正在采取措施，防止通过加密货币交易清洗非法博彩和欺诈的犯罪所得。【原文：Turkey is taking steps to prevent the laundering of criminal proceeds from illegal betting and fraud through cryptocurrency transactions, Finance Minister Mehmet Simsek said on Tuesday.】

item.title: 特朗普宣布以色列与伊朗停火后，美国股指期货上涨
item.description: 由于美国总统唐纳德-特朗普宣布以色列和伊朗停火，美国股指期货周二上涨，这给投资者带来了一些宽慰，此前12天的中东冲突伤害了全球风险资产，并加剧了对通胀的担忧。【原文：U.S. stock index futures rose on Tuesday as President Donald Trump announced a ceasefire between Israel and Iran, bringing investors some relief after 12 days of conflict in the Middle East hurt global risk assets and fanned inflation concerns.】

item.title: 美国大型银行有望通过压力测试并提高股息
item.description: 分析师表示，美国最大的贷款机构今年有望通过美联储的年度体检，这表明它们拥有充足的资本，可以用来提高股息。【原文：The biggest U.S. lenders are expected to clear the Federal Reserve's annual health check this year, showing they have ample capital that can be used to boost dividends, analysts said.】

item.title: 早间竞价石油、利率和美元暴跌
item.description: 当今美国和全球市场的重要事件【原文：What matters in U.S. and global markets today】

item.title: 美国安全委员会将审查波音公司在 737 MAX 9 中空紧急事件中的作用
item.description: 美国国家运输安全委员会将于周二举行听证会，以确定2024年1月一架新波音737 MAX 9航班在飞行途中机舱面板爆炸的可能原因，该事故使该飞机制造商陷入重大危机。【原文：The U.S. National Transportation Safety Board will hold a hearing on Tuesday to determine the probable cause of a mid-air cabin panel blowout of a new Boeing 737 MAX 9 flight in January 2024 that spun the planemaker into a major crisis.】

item.title: LanceDB 为多模态人工智能数据基础设施融资 3000 万美元
item.description: 人工智能数据基础设施公司LanceDB周二表示，该公司获得了3000万美元的A轮融资。【原文：Artificial intelligence data infrastructure company LanceDB raised a $30 million series A round, the company said Tuesday.】

item.title: 独家报道博斯蒂克：美联储应在物价上涨预期下等待降息
item.description: 亚特兰大联储主席拉斐尔-博斯蒂克（Raphael Bostic）告诉路透社记者，由于企业计划在今年晚些时候提高价格以应对更高的进口税，而且就业市场仍然稳定，美联储无需降息。【原文：The Federal Reserve need not cut interest rates with companies planning to raise prices later this year in response to higher import taxes and with the job market still stable, Atlanta Fed President Raphael Bostic told Reuters.】

item.title: 鲍威尔留任美联储，特朗普的任命可能受限
item.description: 美国联邦储备委员会主席杰罗姆-鲍威尔周二将开始为期两天的国会作证，他因没有降息而遭到唐纳德-特朗普总统的抨击，但由于最高法院上个月的一项裁决，他作为央行行长的地位似乎得到了保障，不会被总统采取任何行动。【原文：U.S. Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell begins two days of congressional testimony on Tuesday under fire from President Donald Trump for not cutting interest rates but with his status as head of the central bank seemingly secured from any presidential action by a Supreme Court ruling last month.】
